Articles.Content: I see in some people\'s pictures of KSP game play that there are trees or rocks around. I can\'t see them, even in the exact same location that the pictures were taken, even in the same version. Can someone tell me why and how I can see them? Thanks?
You probably have terrain scatter turned off. Go to the settings panel, and under graphics, select Terrain Scatter, On.

> 
> You probably have terrain scatter turned off. Go to the settings panel, and under graphics, select Terrain Scatter, On.

It\'s on...
Have far away from the launchpad have you ventured? Sometimes you need to travel a little bit.

> 
> Have far away from the launchpad have you ventured? Sometimes you need to travel a little bit.

Farther away you say?

ALLONS-Y!
Make a plane, fly low, have terrain scatter turned on and the slider up to 100%. You\'ll see them soon enough. The mountains north of KSC have a ton of trees all around them.

Yeah, trees only will show up in certain areas of the planet. Usually they spawn near the mountains west of KSC. I\'d look there first, and if they\'re not spawning by then than something must be wrong.

One would think so. I\'m just wondering whether an older graphics card would have trouble rendering the trees at all... It shouldn\'t, but I suppose the possibility is there. What\'re your system specs?

Also, take a screenshot of your Settings screen, so we can see if anything\'s out of the ordinary.

Not sure about system specs... it\'s not an old computer, that\'s for sure.

One screenshot, coming right up!
Try running a dxdiag as well and posting the log file. Just in case something unusual\'s going on.
